content:
• Wednesday, August 31, 2016
  • VISN

    VisionChina Media gets deadline to file late SEC forms

    • Out-of-home advertising firm VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) slid 6.4% in U.S. trading today, alongside news that it got a notification from Nasdaq granting an exception to a listing rule.
    • VisionChina had gotten a noncompliance warning in May tied to late filing of its form 20-F for the year ended Dec. 31, 2015, with the SEC.
    • The new letter says the company must file that form by Sept. 20 at the latest, or face delisting. The company says it expects to make that deadline.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM
  • BRCD

    Argus bucks sentiment, goes bullish on Brocade

    • Brocade Communications Systems (BRCD -2.3%) has gotten a (lonesome) bullish call form Argus, which has reiterated its Buy rating amid an overwhelming Neutral sentiment.
    • Shares have fallen 14% in the four days of trading since the company beat expectations with its fiscal Q3 earnings, but largely due to its acquisition of Ruckus Wireless while the Fibre Channel business disappointed compared to rivals.
    • The sell-off makes an attractive entry point, says Argus' Jim Kelleher, for a company “which is now positioned to break out of slow-growth mode.” He has a price target of $13, implying 44.8% upside from today's closing price.
    • “For the longer terms, Ruckus and other niche assets such as SteelApp increase Brocade’s ability to steer traffic toward its core data center products,” Kelleher said. "Despite current tepid IT spending, we believe the long-term strategic plan is in place.”
    • Several analysts reiterated Neutral ratings last week, and RBC Capital joined them in reiterating a Hold over the weekend.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 PM
  • BOX

    Box posts lower Q2 loss than anticipated; -3% after hours

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) recorded 34% Y/Y billings ($107M) growth and 40% Y/Y deferred revenue ($183M) growth. Operating loss came in at $17.9M (19% of revenue) vs. $32.7M (45% of revenue) Y/Y. Net cash used in operating activities was $4.9M, a 77% Y/Y improvement ($21.7M in Q2 2016). Free cash flow was negative $8M vs. negative $39.8M Y/Y.
    • Projects Q3 revenue of $100M-$101M and raises FY 2017 revenue estimate from $391M-$395M to $394-$396M. Projects basic and diluted Q3 loss per share of $0.35-$0.36 and $0.19-$0.20, respectively. Projects both basic and diluted FY 2017 loss per share of $0.67-$0.69, up from previously estimated $0.75-$0.78 loss.
    • Earnings deck
    • Conference call
    • Results
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • DELL

    Charter Communications +3.4% as it heads to replace EMC in S&P 500

    • Charter Communications (CHTR +0.5%) -- newly larger after its deals for Time Warner Cable and Bright House Networks -- is up 3.4% after hours following news that it's joining the S&P 500 after the close on Sept. 7.
    • Charter's replacing EMC, headed for a purchase by Dell around that time, in the index.
    • Meanwhile, Kraft Heinz (KHC +1.7%) will replace EMC in the S&P 100.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • CYNA

    Cynapsus Therapeutics bought by Sunovion Pharma for $624M

    • Cynapsus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYNA) +117.9% AH after agreeing to be acquired by privately-held Sunovion Pharmaceuticals for $40.50/share in cash, or ~$624M.
    • Sunovion would acquire CYNA's APL-130277 product candidate, which is designed to be an easy-to-use, on-demand treatment option for Parkinson’s disease.
    • Sunovion says the deal expands its leadership in treatments for central nervous system disorders.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 17 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: OXM +9.0%. OLLI +8.3%. PI +4.8%. ZFGN +4.2%. CHTR +3.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: CRM -7.5%. SCVL -5.6%. FIVE -4.7%. BLOX -3.0%. CTRP -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • UNIT

    Communications Sales & Leasing closes $230M Tower Cloud purchase

    • Communication Sales & Leasing (CSAL +1.8%) has wrapped an acquisition of Tower Cloud, a deal that was set in June for $230M in cash and stock.
    • CS&L paid $185M in cash, using on-hand funds and its revolving credit, and issued 1.9M common shares for a stock portion.
    • The company is combining Tower Cloud and its previously acquired PEG Bandwidth into a unit called Uniti Fiber, led by Ron Mudry.
    • That division has 406,000 strand miles of fiber, with 184,000 strand miles awarded for future deployment.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • FIVE

    Five Below lower after guidance falls slightly short

    • Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) reports operating income increased 36% in Q2 to $15.7M.
    • Comparable sales were up 3.9% during the quarter.
    • The company ended the quarter with 491 stores, up 33 from last year's count.
    • Guidance from Five Below: FY16 revenue $1B-$1.009B vs. $1.01B consensus, EPS of $1.28-$1.32 vs. $1.31 consensus.
    • Previously: Five Below beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Aug. 31)
    • FIVE -4.47% AH to $42.52.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 7 Comments
  • APPS

    Digital Turbine names Garrison new chief financial officer

    • Digital Turbine (APPS +10.3%) has named Barrett Garrison its new chief financial officer.
    • Garrison replaces Andrew Schleimer; the move is effective Sept. 12. Schleimer will assist in transferring duties over the next 30 days.
    • Garrison had previously served as CFO of NetSpend, which he helped guide to a public offering. He also served as CFO of Competitor Group and as financial controller at Dell Financial Services.
    • Shares were on the move today alongside news of an upgrade from Ladenburg Thalmann, to Buy from Neutral.
    • The analysts bumped their price target on APPS to $2.35 from $1.26, implying 69.1% upside from today's closing price.
    • After hours, APPS -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • OLLI

    Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet (NASDAQ:OLLI): Q2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $211.3M (+16.1% Y/Y) beats by $3.69M.
    • Shares +4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • YY

    YY up 7% as JPMorgan initiates at Overweight

    • YY is up 7% today after JPMorgan launched coverage at Overweight with an eye toward an advantageous shift toward mobile broadcasting.
    • The analysts believe a tumble in May -- YY went from $62.87 to $48.80 over three trading days -- was likely due to investors hearing chatter (eventually confirmed) about a withdrawn go-private plan. They've set a price target of $62, implying 29% upside from yesterday's close.
    • Progress toward mobile broadcasting from PCs is going more slowly than peers, JPMorgan notes, but it has key advantages that should grease the skids: an established ecosystem, social orientation, and steady supply of content.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 29 Comments
  • PBR

    Brazil may open Petrobras offshore areas to other companies, official says

    • Brazil may allow companies other than Petrobras (PBR -3.5%) to bid for the right to produce extra oil from areas it sold to the company in 2010, says the head of exploration and production policy at the energy ministry.
    • The official also says the government may allow PBR to pay with oil for adjustments in the price of the maximum 5B boe natural gas it is allowed to produce in the areas.
    • Separately, PBR says it will gain access to ~$11B following the sale of exploration and production rights to the Carcara field to Statoil; While the direct gain will be just $2.5B, PBR will be relieved of its obligations to invest $7.9B-$8.6B in the development of the field.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 24 Comments
  • GOGO

    Gogo +2.2% on insider buy, upgrade

    • Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) is on the move with sudden action this afternoon, up 2.2%, following an upgrade and an SEC filing showing a director buying in with more than $600,000.
    • Over the past two days, according to the Form 4, Charles Townsend acquired a total of 52,867 shares for about an aggregate $625,950.
    • Townsend's beneficial ownership is at 354,267 shares after the moves.
    • Meanwhile, Standpoint Research upgraded the stock to Buy from its previous Hold rating.
    • Gogo shares are down 30% YTD, but have risen 48% over the past month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 2 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: APPS +20%. LOV +15%. OTC:NLST +14%. OTC:CCUR +9%. ISIL +9%.
    • Losers: DDD -9%. PANW -8%. BOSC -8%. NETE -7%. SMI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • BLOX

    Reuters: Infoblox sale initiated; shares +6%

    • The report notes Infoblox (BLOX +6.2%) has realized pressure from Starboard Value, which took an activist stake in the company earlier this year.
    • Private equity firm Thoma Bravo was said to have laid out an offer for Infoblox back in May, though other suitors are surmised to be in the mix.
    • Q4 results to come after the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: MTRX +15%. FELP +8%. MTL +8%. SYMX +6%. KOS +6%.
    • Losers: OSN -10%. CDXC -9%. NADL -8%. CWEI -9%. SAEX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • TWTR

    Twitter +5%; co-founder notes company would 'have to consider the right options' when asked about acquisition climate

    • Evan Williams, Twitter (TWTR +5.2%) co-founder and board member, issued the comment on a Bloomberg West segment (13:55 mark) yesterday evening.
    • Takeover speculation has circulated in many forms over past months, with the latest rumors surfacing earlier in August.
    • The company's shares have lost 30% in value over the last year, a primary factor contributing to the ever-revolving buzz.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 29 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy upgraded at RBC ahead of exploration plans

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS +5.5%) is sharply higher after RBC Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Sector Perform with a $9 price target, raised from $6, as the firm expects the company to utilize the next few quarters to unveil its exploration plans for Mauritania and Senegal.
    • RBC thinks KOS likely will start with source rocks and leads and eventually culminate with a farm-out deal, and the firm recommends accumulating the stock ahead of the news flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • XLE

    Stocks add to losses; Dow down 100

    • A 3.4% tumble in oil is pushing the major averages to modest afternoon losses, with the Dow and S&P 500 down 0.55% and the Nasdaq 0.45%. Leading the S&P lower, naturally, is the energy sector (XLE -1.8%).
    • Previously: Crude futures decline on inventory build (Aug. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • MXIM

    Reuters: Intersil likely to select Renesas over Maxim in buyout; +10%

    • An agreement could reportedly be announced as soon as next week, though sources note nothing is final and that Maxim Integrated Products (MXIM -0.1%) may still disrupt a deal.
    • Japan's Renesas Electronics (OTCPK:RNECF) confirmed last week it was discussing options with Intersil (ISIL +10.4%) regarding a takeover that could be valued at $3B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 8 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: SPU +35%. MTRX +17%. SINO +16%. XNY +15%. TRR +14%.
    • Losers: YRD -8%. GNW -8%. IFMI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • TOT

    Reuters: Total preparing sale of TotalErg petrol station network

    • Total (TOT -1.5%) and Italian renewable energy group Erg have hired banks in seeking to sell Italy's TotalErg petrol station network, in a deal that could be valued at up to €700M ($781M) depending on which assets are sold off, Reuters reports.
    • Italy's petrol station network is swollen with ~21K stations across the country, 2x the number in France and nearly 3x that in Britain, and a draft bill in parliament seeks to cut the number of stations to bring them into line with demand.
    • A sale of TotalErg, which controls ~2,600 service stations in Italy, would come after a similar move by Royal Dutch Shell in 2014 sold a network of 830 pump stations in Italy to Kuwait Petroleum.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SPU +32%. MTRX +16%. SINO +15%. TRR +15%. XNY +15%. CHS +13%. CFI +10%. OTC:CCUR +10%. FELP +8%. OTC:NLST +8%.
    • Losers: ATOS -28%. HEB -20%. AVAV -19%. NCS -14%. MAGS -12%. IRG -11%. RIGL -11%. HRB -11%. NADL -10%. CIDM -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger slips on glum outlook for Q3 drilling work

    • Schlumberger (SLB -1.9%) is lower after warning in an investor presentation that it expects Q3 results to come in "slightly lower" as West Africa, Brazil and Asia see further declines in deepwater drilling.
    • While SLB has seen more work thanks to an increase in the U.S. rig count, "there has yet to be any material change in pricing" for the service work, president of operations Patrick Schorn said.
    • After the update, RBC analysts cut their EPS estimates for SLB in 2016, 2017 and 2018 to $1.04, $2.89 and $4.48, respectively from $1.18, $2.99 and $4.55, driven by the company's more tepid than expected outlook for the drilling and reservoir characterization segments.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • BIND

    Shareholders in BIND Therapeutics hit the sell button after record date for future payouts; shares down 66%

    • Bankrupt biotech BIND Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BIND) (currently listed as BINDQ) craters 66% on turnover of 5.5M shares as investors bail out after yesterday's stockholders-of-record date qualifying eligible shareholders to receive future cash distributions from the company's liquidation. A confirmation hearing is set for September 21.
    • Last month, Pfizer (PFE -0.6%) agreed to acquire the assets for $20M.
    • Previously: BIND Therapeutics +101% as it accepts Pfizer's stalking-horse bid (July 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 33 Comments

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SPU +37%. XNY +8%. KEQU +8%. CAL +6%.
    • Losers: GIII -8%. LFVN -7%. NAV -6%. LTEA -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNKD

    MannKind says EpiPen alternative is lead program; shares up 13%

    • Micro cap MannKind (MNKD +13.4%) tries to regain some ground after its recent sell-off on the news that it is working on a less-costly alternative to Mylan's (MYL -1.1%) EpiPen (epinephrine injection, USP). CEO Matt Pfeffer says his firm is working on an inhalable formulation of the allergic reaction medication that will be "much cheaper" than Mylan's branded product. He adds that the company has been working on the project for some time and it considers it its lead program.
    • MannKind expects to file an IND in early next year. It needs to do something. Inhaled insulin Afrezza has been a complete flop.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 79 Comments
  • DE

    U.S. moves to block Deere's deal for Monsanto's Precision Planting

    • Deere (DE -1.1%) last November had agreed to buy Monsanto's (MON -1.1%) Precision Planting equipment unit, and had then hoped to close the deal in 60-90 days.
    • According to Bloomberg. the government has filed suit to block the sale, saying it would eliminate competition and raise costs for farmers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 9 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle looks to students for traffic boost

    • Chipotle's (CMG +0.2%) success in executing a turnaround may be determined by its ability to become very popular  with students again.
    • Nomura analyst Mark Kalinowski thinks the recently-announced free drink promotion aimed at students is strategic, although the path back to prior sales levels is still very long.
    • Nomura is one of 18 investment firms with a Neutral/Hold rating on CMG, compared to the 6 Sells and 14 Buys on record.
    • Hedgeye's Howard Penney tipped off earlier today that he will be updating his CMG short thesis on September 8.
    • The flip side of the CMG debate is offered up to SA contributor Adelphi Venture Capital. On the issue of the free drink promotion, Adelphi writes, "as simple as this promotion is, we think it will have a strong appeal with cash-strapped students and could entice them into store in their droves."
    • Previously: New Chipotle promotion doles out free drinks to students (Aug. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 7 Comments
  • USCR

    US Concrete on the move

    • US Concrete (NASDAQ:USCR) heads lower early in the session, down 7.6%.
    • The stock is now flat since the beginning of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar cut to Hold from Buy at Argus on price competition concerns

    • First Solar (FSLR -2.3%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Argus, citing a softer project backlog and the impact of increased pricing competition.
    • The firm says that with solar tax incentives now renewed through 2019, customers have less urgency to complete projects sooner, which has benefited FSLR.
    • However, Argus continues to view FSLR as the best positioned company in the solar industry based on its ability to remain profitable even as peers have been hurt by oversupplied markets and a lack of pricing power; its investment in cadmium telluride technology, which should provide a cost advantage relative to more commoditized technologies such as polysilicon; and its positive cash flow and solid balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 32 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: MIRN +8%.
    • Losers: ATOS -29%. HEB -16%. RIGL -11%. JUNO -8%. SPHS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks -8% on minimal sequential revenue growth projection

    • While Palo Alto Networks' (PANW -7.9%) Q4 numbers were good, the company's provided guidance is sending shares lower.
    • It sees $396M-$402M (vs. $400.8M just reported) in Q1 2017 revenue and $0.51-$0.53 (vs. $0.50 just reported) in Q1 net income per share.
    • Analysts (Goldman Sachs, BTIG, Baird, Wunderlich and others) out with notes today, though, remain generally positive on the company's prospects.
    • Earnings call transcript
    • Earnings slides
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • HEB

    Hemispherx Bio inks direct equity offering at $1.50; shares slump 19%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Hemispherx Biopharma (HEB -19.2%) slumps on more than double normal volume in response to its announcement of a private $5M equity placement with two institutional investors. The deal consists of common stock at $1.50, with each share being paired with one five-year warrant to purchase 3/4 of a share of common at $2.00.
    • Net proceeds will fund technology transfer opportunities, expenses related to Ampligen manufacturing, working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $1.77.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • SDPI

    Superior Drilling +11% on expansion of territory for Drill-n-Ream tools

    • Superior Drilling Products (SDPI +11.2%) surges in early trading after announcing an agreement with the distributor of its Drill-n-Ream tools that expands its exclusive territory to include the Rocky Mountain region.
    • SDPI also says Drilling Tools International will purchase $500K of previously operated Drill-N-Ream well bore conditioning tools from SDPI with the option to purchase more.
    • SDPI says its moves will eliminate ~$1.2M/year in costs related to sales and marketing and tool distribution infrastructure.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • PRXL

    Parexel falls 4.8% on 10-K filing delay

    • Parexel (NASDAQ:PRXL) drops 4.8% early on after saying yesterday post market it was delaying its 10-K filing after it received a report, "of an incident of misappropriation of corporate funds by an employee in one of the Company’s international operations.
    • "The Company is reviewing this matter and, accordingly, is unable to file the 2016 Form 10-K by the prescribed due date (Aug. 29) without unreasonable effort or expense.
    • "Based on the information currently available, the Company does not believe the amount of funds misappropriated to be material, but there can be no assurance in this regard until the Company completes its review.
    • "The Company expects to file the 2016 Form 10-K as soon as reasonably practicable, and, at this time, the Company anticipates that it will be able to do so within the extension period of 15 calendar days provided under Rule 12b-25 of the Securities Exchange Act, as amended."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • HRB

    H&R Block tumbles after earnings miss

    • While H&R Block's (NYSE:HRB) fiscal first quarter typically represents less than 5% of annual revenues and less than 15% of annual expenses, management in the last couple of years has boosted expectations for off-season quarters with its "year round" plan, writes BTIG's Mark Palmer.
    • In that respect, last night's 2017 FQ1 top- and bottom-line misses were a disappointment, says Palmer. Adjusted loss per share of $0.55 matched his estimate, but fell short of the $0.53 consensus, and revenue of $125.2M missed the Street at $132.8M and Palmer at $140M.
    • He cuts his FY17 and FY18 EPS estimates to $1.74 and $1.88, respectively, from $1.84 and $2.10 previously, and maintains a Neutral rating.
    • Shares are down 9.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage upgraded to Outperform at Oppenheimer & Co.; +2%

    • Sets $15 price target (current price $11.92).
    • Analyst Ittai Kidron: "We're bullish on Pure's progress toward CF break-even and profitability, and its ability to capitalize on differentiated technology, AFA growth, and on expansion opportunities with new products (especially FlashBlade), new customers, and internationally. We believe concerns regarding GM declines are an overreaction, and that within two to three quarters a recovery and potential expansion are possible as FlashBlade comes up its production curve."
    • Pure Storage (PSTG +2.1%) posted better-than-expected Q2 results last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 9 Comments
  • CHS

    Chico's FAS spikes after earnings

    • Shares of Chico's FAS (NYSE:CHS) are up 12.30% after the company topped estimates on both lines of its Q2 report.
    • Comparable sales were down 3.1% during the quarter, while gross margin as a percentage of sales fell 70 bps to 37.9%. Chico's ended the quarter with inventory of $235.64M.
    • Looking ahead, Chico's says an organizational redesign is expected to generate approximately $25M in annualized savings and help make the company more nimble.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • NAVB

    Texas court rules in favor of financier, Navidea has 21 days to enter into account control agreements; shares off 8%

    • Nano cap Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB -8.1%) eases on average volume in response to its disclosure that a Texas district court has granted Capital Royalty Partners II L.P.'s (and others; collectively: CRG) request for temporary injunction against the company seeking to restrain it from operating or using new financial accounts without first signing requisite blocked account control and pledge collateral account control agreements with CRG. The ruling stipulates that Navidea has 21 days from August 30 to ink the contracts.
    • The dispute arose in May when CRG notified the company that it was in default on its contract and CRG was entitled to certain remedies (i.e., seizing cash collateral).
    • Previously: Financier says Navidea in default on loan, tries to seize company's accounts (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 145 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: SINO +37%. VEEV +8%. MTL +6%. CHS +6%. ININ +6%. KOS +5%.
    • Losers: ATOS -29%. HEB -13%. SAEX -10%. FRO -7%. PANW -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • PSG

    Performance Sports Group lands extension with creditors

    • Performance Sports Group (NYSE:PSG) receives a 60-day extension from creditors to work out a deal.
    • The company was at risk of going into default without the extension.
    • Shares of PSG are up 51% since last Thursday on increased hopes of a creditor deal that will keep the sports equipment seller out of bankruptcy.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans higher after lifting profit guidance

    • Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE) reported a higher profit in FQ1 than anticipated, despite a drop in sales.
    • Comparable sales were down 4.3% during the quarter and total sales in the restaurant segment fell 7.7% Y/Y to $220.4M.
    • Sales at BEF Foods increased 3.5% to $85.9M during the quarter. Pounds sold were up 6.4%, but the average net selling price per pound was down 2.7%.
    • The company raised full-year EPS guidance to a range of $2.05-$2.20 vs. $2.00-$2.15 prior and $2.06 consensus.
    • BOBE +3.77% premarket to $40.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • FELP

    Foresight Energy completes global restructuring

    • Foresight Energy (NYSE:FELP) +8.5% premarket after completing an out-of-court restructuring of more than $1.4B in indebtedness related to the terms of recent transaction support agreements.
    • FELP's restructuring resolves various defaults and events of default relating to a December 2015 Delaware court determination that the company’s previous equity transaction involving Murray Energy was a “change of control” of FELP.
    • Restructuring was implemented through concurrent exchange and tender offers in which holders of virtually all of the principal amount of the old notes participated.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 7 Comments
  • RXDX

    FDA OKs the use of Ignyta's investigational next-gen sequencing assay as a companion diagnostic in mid-stage study of entrectinib; shares up 4% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Ignyta (NASDAQ:RXDX) is up 4% premarket, albeit on only 1,232 shares, in response to its announcement that the FDA has approved its IDE (investigational device exemption) for its companion diagnostic next-generation sequencing (NGS) assay, Trailblaze Pharos. The company intends to use it to identify patients with NTRK1/2/3-, ROS1- or ALK-positive solid tumors to determine eligibility in its Phase 2 STARTRK-2 clinical trial evaluating lead product candidate entrectinib in a range of cancers, particularly non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC).
    • The IDE allows Trailblaze Pharos to be used in a clinical study to collect safety and effectiveness data that will support a Premarket Approval (PMA) application. Previously, the company used a laboratory developed test (LDT) version of Trailblaze Pharos to screen patients for inclusion in the study. An LDT test is one that is designed, manufactured and used within a single laboratory and can be used to generate results without being FDA approved. An LDT cannot be packaged as a kit and sold to other labs.
    • STARTRK-2 is a 300-subject open-label basket study assessing entrectinib for the treatment of locally advanced/metastatic solid tumors. The primary endpoint is objective response rate (ORR) at Month 24. According ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated final data collection date for the primary endpoint is October 2017. The estimated study completion date is October 2018.
    • Entrectinib, a selective tyrosine kinase inhibitor, is being developed for the treatment of a variety of tumor types. Tyrosine kinase is an enzyme that serves as an "on/off" switch in many cellular functions. If stuck "on" unregulated cell growth occurs.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • SAN

    Santander upgraded at Deutsche Bank; up 2.75% premarket

    • Citing strong earnings momentum and an attractive valuation, Deutsche upgrades Banco Santander (NYSE:SAN) to Buy from Hold.
    • The stock's higher by 2.75% in active premarket action alongside a nice rally in the major European banks. Rumors of a Deutsche Bank/Commerzbank tie-up again made headlines today, though Deutsche CEO John Cryan quickly denied interest.
